newsitem.title: USA: Boston Ed's Pilgrim has 'unusual event'.
newsitem.headline: Boston Ed's Pilgrim has 'unusual event'.

text.p: Boston Edison Co said an "unusual event" was declared at its Pilgrim nuclear plant at 0349 EST Tuesday in accordance with plant procedures after the loss of off-site power during a severe winter storm.

There was no loss of power to safety systems and all emergency systems performed as designed, Boston Edison said. An unusual event is the lowest of four emergency declarations designated by the Nuclear Regulatory Commission.
The Plymouth, Mass., plant has been off-line since Feb. 15 for a planned refueling outage. The emergency declaration will be maintained until the weather improves, Boston Edison said.
